current-chamber.#text: In the House of Representatives, U. S.,

official-title.#text: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5771) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend certain expiring provisions and make technical corrections, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 647) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for the tax treatment of ABLE accounts established under State programs for the care of family members with disabilities, and for other purposes.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to extend certain expiring provisions and make technical corrections, and for other purposes. All points of order against consideration of the bill are waived. The amendment printed in part A of the report of the

accompanying this resolution shall be considered as adopted. The bill, as amended, shall be considered as read. All points of order against provisions in the bill, as amended, are waived. The previous question shall be considered as ordered on the bill, as amended, and on any further amendment thereto, to final passage without intervening motion except: (1) one hour of debate equally divided and controlled by the chair and ranking minority member of the
; and (2) one motion to recommit with or without instructions.

text.#text: That upon adoption of this resolution it shall be in order to consider in the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to provide for the tax treatment of ABLE accounts established under State programs for the care of family members with disabilities, and for other purposes. All points of order against consideration of the bill are waived. In lieu of the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the
now printed in the bill, the amendment in the nature of a substitute printed in part B of the report of the

accompanying this resolution shall be considered as adopted. The bill, as amended, shall be considered as read. All points of order against provisions in the bill, as amended, are waived. The previous question shall be considered as ordered on the bill, as amended, and on any further amendment thereto, to final passage without intervening motion except: (1) one hour of debate equally divided and controlled by the chair and ranking minority member of the
; and (2) one motion to recommit with or without instructions.

text.#text: Upon adoption of this resolution it shall be in order to consider in the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Clerk of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , as new matter at the end of

text.#text: assign appropriate designations to provisions within the engrossment; and
conform cross-references and provisions for short titles within the engrossment.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 766 EH: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5771) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend certain expiring provisions and make technical corrections, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 647) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for the tax treatment of ABLE accounts established under State programs for the care of family members with disabilities, and for other purposes.
